byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Beijing.

abstract: United States and Philippines prepare to begin expanded military relationship allowing United States to build facilities at five Philippines military bases; agreement revives American presence in Philippines after 25 years and is driven in part by China's increasing aggression in South China Sea.
lead_paragraph: A new agreement will allow the United States to spread more American troops, planes and ships across the Philippines than have been there in decades.

headline.main: Eye on China, U.S. and Philippines Ramp Up Military Alliance
headline.print_headline: Eye on China, U.S. and Philippines Ramp Up Military Alliance

snippet: A new agreement will allow the United States to spread more American troops, planes and ships across the Philippines than have been there in decades.
